Class TiGPIO

    The TiGPIO for devicecenter of framework.
    Author:
    Andy.

      • open

        public static TiGPIO open(int portID,
                          int... pinIDs)
                   throws java.io.IOException
        Open the TiGPIO port by port id and the pin list, and return the object
        Parameters:
        portID - port id
        pinIDs - the pin id use, range:0-15
        Returns:
        TiGPIO object
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - If a TiGPIO error occurs

      • portNumber

        public static int portNumber()
        Maximum number of port supported
        Returns:
        number

      • readPin

        public int readPin(int pinID)
            throws java.io.IOException
        Read the pin level value
        Parameters:
        pinID - the pin id, range:0-15
        Returns:
        pin level value, 0:low level, 1:high level
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - If a TiGPIO error occurs

      • readPort

        public int readPort()
             throws java.io.IOException
        Read the port value
        Returns:
        port value, For example: if pinIDs = {0,3,5}, it means pin0, pin3, pin5 are enabled
        value=33(0x21):pin0=1, pin1=X, pin2=X, pin3=0, pin4=X, pin5=1, pin6=X, pin7=X, X:ignore
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - If a TiGPIO error occurs

      • setEventParameters

        public void setEventParameters(int pinID,
                               int evt,
                               int captureFilter)
                        throws java.io.IOException
        Set the pin event parameters
        Parameters:
        pinID - pin id, range:0-15
        evt - pin event,
        EVT_NONE: none event (default)
        EVT_RISINGEDGE: rising edge event
        EVT_FALLINGEDGE: falling edge event
        EVT_BOTHEDGE: both edge event
        captureFilter - the event capture filter time window, unit:us
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - If a TiGPIO error occurs

      • setWorkMode

        public void setWorkMode(int pinID,
                        int mode)
                 throws java.io.IOException
        Set the pin work mode
        Parameters:
        pinID - pin id, range:0-15
        mode - pin mode,
        INPUT_FLOATING: floating input (default)
        INPUT_PULLUP: pull-up input
        INPUT_PULLDOWN: pull-down input
        OUTPUT_OD: open drain output
        OUTPUT_PP: push-pull output
        IO_FLOATING_OD: floating input and open drain output
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - If a TiGPIO error occurs

      • writePin

        public void writePin(int pinID,
                     int levelValue)
              throws java.io.IOException
        Write the pin level value
        Parameters:
        pinID - the pin id, range:0-15
        levelValue - pin level value, 0:low level, 1:high level
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - If a TiGPIO error occurs

      • writePort

        public void writePort(int value)
               throws java.io.IOException
        Write the port value
        Parameters:
        value - port value, For example: if pinIDs = {0,3,5}, it means pin0, pin3, pin5 are enabled
        value=33(0x21):pin0=1, pin1=X, pin2=X, pin3=0, pin4=X, pin5=1, pin6=X, pin7=X, X:ignore
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - If a TiGPIO error occurs
